title: False or misleading statements by Donald Trump
deleted: In March 2019, Trump asserted that the special counsel investigation was "illegal". Previously in June 2018, Trump argued that "the appointment of the Special Counsel is totally UNCONSTITUTIONAL!" However, in August 2018, [[Dabney L. Friedrich|Dabney Friedrich]], a Trump-appointed judge on the [[United States District Court for the District of Columbia|DC District Court]] ruled the appointment was constitutional, as did a unanimous three-judge panel of the [[United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit|Court of Appeals for the DC Circuit]] in February 2019.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.cnn.com/2019/03/21/politics/fact-check-trump-says-mueller-investigation-is-illegal/index.html |title=Fact-check: Trump claims Mueller investigation 'illegal', ignoring multiple court rulings |first1=Holmes |last1=Lybrand |first2=Marshall |last2=Cohen |publisher=CNN |access-date=March 23, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190322211918/https://www.cnn.com/2019/03/21/politics/fact-check-trump-says-mueller-investigation-is-illegal/index.html |archive-date=March 22, 2019 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Dukakis |first1=Ali |title=Appeals court says special counsel Robert Mueller 'properly appointed'; orders ex-Stone aide to testify |url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/appeals-court-mueller-properly-appointed-orders-stone-aide/story?id=61327058 |work=[[ABC News]] |access-date=March 23, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190327085953/https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/appeals-court-mueller-properly-appointed-orders-stone-aide/story?id=61327058 |archive-date=March 27, 2019 |url-status=live }}</ref>

title: False or misleading statements by Donald Trump
added: Trump repeatedly claimed that the U.S. had a $500 billion annual trade deficit with China before his presidency; the actual deficit never reached $400 billion prior to his presidency.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Dale|first=Daniel|date=January 16, 2021|title=Analysis: The 15 most notable lies of Donald Trump's presidency|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/16/politics/fact-check-dale-top-15-donald-trump-lies/index.html|url-status=live|access-date=2021-09-19|website=CNN}}</ref>
